attires.name: Kanzashi
attires.description: Traditional hair ornaments worn in the hair of women. They come in many shapes and materials, including silk flowers, lacquered wood, and metal.

attires.name: Hachimaki
attires.description: A stylized headband, usually made of red or white cloth, worn as a symbol of effort or courage by the wearer.

attires.name: Tsunokakushi
attires.description: A white hood or headdress worn by brides in traditional Shinto weddings, said to hide the bride's 'horns' of jealousy and ego.
